intro: Trichostema oblongum, commonly known as the narrowleaf stickseed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to oblong in shape, and have a slightly hairy surface. Trichostema oblongum produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
